name: Cox's Bazar
description: Cox's Bazar is a beach town located in the southeastern part of Bangladesh. It is known for its long sandy beach, which is one of the longest in the world.

name: Sundarbans
description: The Sundarbans is a mangrove forest located in the southwestern part of Bangladesh. It is home to the Royal Bengal Tiger and many other endangered species.

name: Srimangal
description: Srimangal is a small town located in the northeastern part of Bangladesh. It is known for its tea gardens and is often referred to as the 'tea capital' of Bangladesh.

name: Paharpur
description: Paharpur is an archaeological site located in the northern part of Bangladesh. It is home to the ruins of an ancient Buddhist monastery that dates back to the 8th century.

name: Sajek Valley
description: Sajek Valley is a scenic hill station located in the northwestern part of Bangladesh. It is known for its picturesque landscapes and is a popular destination for trekking and hiking.
